comments:
I opened bug 59777 and sent a test class. I was able to get it to open after 
changing some of the things the editor was not able to handle. Shortly after, 
I installed Java 1.5.0_beta1 to test out. Due to some wierd problems, I 
uninstalled 1.5 and re-installed 1.4.2_02. Now the same test class, and others 
in my project won't open in the visual editor. Other project classes seem to 
open fine. I even deleted eclipse and re-installed everything but the result 
was the same. As before, the test class opens fine in 2.1.3.

I get this in the log file. I will attach the testclass and show a screen 
print of what I am now getting.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ve.java.core 4 0 Apr 30, 2004 12:03:29.70
!MESSAGE Exception thrown.
!STACK 0

	at

(BeanPart.java:798)

ces(JavaSourceTranslator.java:626)

Created an attachment (id=10176)
example class exhibiting the problem

Created an attachment (id=10177)
picture of what the editor shows after the exception

Bug should be closed.

After installing VE 1.0M1, re-installing jdk 1.4.2_02 and deleting my project 
and creating it from scratch, all seems to be working now.

I had no problem to open the attached class.  

The attached editor image denotes that there is no Palette in your editor ...
this is saying that the VE cold not find a JRE on your class path which will be
consistend with the exception you are getting.


Make sure that you are setting the JRE on your build path
Project->Properties->Java Build path->Libraries->Add Libraries

Use the JRE System Library, and that it is configured to a proper JRE
Since this bug was not reOpened for more than a month, this bug is verified.
